website_summaries.verdict: A versatile stainless steel oven thermometer that's easy to read and use.
pros: Versatile thermometer can be hung or stood upright
Reads a broad range of 150°F to 550°F
A practical addition to any kitchen

customer_reviews.title: This is the ONLY thermometer I have ever had that stays put and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Seriously. I can't tell you how many oven thermometers I have been through and most of them have almost landed me in the looney bin. Most models fall off the rack as soon as you open or close the oven. This is the ONLY thermometer I have ever had that stays put and works like a charm. Purchase this immediately and save yourself a ton of mental anguish.
customer_reviews.author: hjh

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever, Does Not Fall Off Oven Rack
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the customer review that says this one stays put. In my 72 years I have gone through lots of oven thermometers and this is the only one I ever found that does not fall off the oven rack. I love it! As far as accuracy, I put three different brands in my oven, my old one and two new, this and another brand, and all three showed the same temperature (my oven is five degree off) but I hate the other two because they are easily knocked off the rack.
customer_reviews.author: S. tamburinTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Worthless: impossible to read temperature
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute piece of junk. Sorry Polder, but it's not up to your standards. After just 3 months of use, the clear glass window became foggy. Nothing spilled on it, and yet it was impossible to see the needle. Yes, it was inexpensive, but I didn't think it was disposable. Mine is now in the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: iFrank

customer_reviews.title: problem and a hacky fix
customer_reviews.text: It's a good thermometer, but when it's place on the oven rack (where I prefer to put it), it easily falls over & then is awkward to pick up or set right. So I cut a piece of thin plywood 3 1/2"x4 1/2" & attached the thermometer to it with with 4 screws and washers. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Perry

customer_reviews.title: This is worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great - I found that it has to heat up with the oven and then stay in there to continuously give a readout for your oven temp. Then I purchased a new oven!
customer_reviews.author: Janet C. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT accurate at all, tested in 3 different ovens, they are all off by as much as 100 degree's. I can accept a slight difference but not that much. I have never been disappointed by Polder thermometers till I bought this one. Now to find another one that might actually work.
customer_reviews.author: CID Buyer

customer_reviews.title: To calibrate the oven tempature.
customer_reviews.text: To use in my extra large toaster convection oven, works very well. I have tried other one's but this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: SHARI SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate thermometer! Now I can get my oven temperature right! and It doesn't tip over easily like my old one. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the face is small and difficult to read.
customer_reviews.author: Olliecat

customer_reviews.title: Stays put. 😃
customer_reviews.text: Weight is not an issue. I like that it stays put. Other easily fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderlust

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love that it does not fall off in oven, just is a little hard to read.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Stable, accurate, sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I love the wider base! Have two - one for each oven. They are accurate and don't tip over as easily as others. Very well made. Definitely recommend to anyone needing an oven thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Kayce Cawthon McCarty

customer_reviews.title: ... our Christmas prime rib dinner and it turned out perfect. We have learned that our oven is a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for our Christmas prime rib dinner and it turned out perfect. We have learned that our oven is a little off in temperature since using this device, it seems very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Navydustin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This does what it is supposed to do and seems to measure the temperature accurately.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. Only used it a couple of times but ...
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. Only used it a couple of times but it was accurate to another oven thermometer I had. Plus it doesn't fall over so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jopalis

customer_reviews.title: Best Oven Thermometer I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Oven Thermometer. I'd had it with the kind that hang from the top shelf. They were always in the way. If I stood them on the shelf instead of hanging they fell over. Then I found this beauty. Sits right where I put it. I can move it easily if need be. I could hang it if I wanted to also. Works great and doesn't get as dirty as the other kind for some reason. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bun

customer_reviews.title: I like it...
customer_reviews.text: Like that it clips on and can hang from a wire rack. Oh..eight more words required, so, well, um, it tells temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around timer you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: Been a big fan of these timers for a decade. We use it not just for cooking but also as a reminder timer for appointments, an alarm clock (set it to go off up to 9hrs 59 min), you name it. Lanyard makes it really useful when moving around different parts of the house. Convenient magnet to attach to the fridge. Recommended without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Secutor

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer that doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this thermometer because I liked the way one could hook it over a rack. But the first time I used it, it only went up to 300 degrees, when it should have been 375 degrees. Then I just cranked the oven up for a while, and it continued to say 300 degrees. My ancient oven thermometer still works, and the temperature was 500. One of the more disappointing purchases I've made. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than most.
customer_reviews.text: This product stands up in my oven way better than others I’ve ordered. Ones that are hook are fine until you need to slide some thing on the oven rack and they get knocked off. This one sits nicely on the rack without a raised hook.
customer_reviews.author: Melly B

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little product! It hangs really well on my oven rack and is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: flamingopink

customer_reviews.title: Okay..... here's my only pet ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay.....here's my only pet peeve and it has nothing to do with this product. Oven manufacturers tend to put the light at the rear of the oven and if you try to hang this off the front of the rack it is difficult to read through the double window of the oven (yes, my oven window is clean). If you hang it sideways to capture the light then you can't really read the gauge without opening the door.
customer_reviews.author: Christine G

customer_reviews.title: Accu9
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three different brands. This one and one other matched the other was way off. So happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: happy bird

customer_reviews.title: Sits on oven rack
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this item. Sits nicely on oven rack. Easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: dolores doris reis

customer_reviews.title: I set my oven to bake some beans at about ...
customer_reviews.text: I set my oven to bake some beans at about 195 ̊F (don't want it to boil--212 ̊--right?) This thermometer read 350 ̊! And, no, the beans weren't boiling. Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Borofsky

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thermometer as well as the CDN POT750X High Heat Oven Thermometer and found that they were off by 25 degrees of each other. Now that may be because I stood this one on the oven rack and hung the POT750X from the rack. I ended up going with the POT750X as I like the fact you can hang it up and it stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: melk1999

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer clips onto rack securely, but has enough of ...
customer_reviews.text: Thermometer clips onto rack securely, but has enough of a base to stand on its own. Seems accurate; hard to know.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Ack

customer_reviews.title: other than that its great.
customer_reviews.text: exActly what I was looking for. I had to mark the ring around the dial because it was hard to read. But, other than that its great.
customer_reviews.author: Sierraflowr

customer_reviews.title: Finally one that doesn't fall off the oven racks!
customer_reviews.text: It appears more accurate than past thermometers we have used and this one actually stays on the racks in the over and gives you more options for placement the way it is made.
customer_reviews.author: skf1965

customer_reviews.title: Great design but not accurate
customer_reviews.text: It does stay put on the oven rack, but the temperature reading is off by 10-15 degrees. Guess I have to stick with the accurate one that falls off!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an oven thermometer and knew the basic temerature of my new kitchenaid oven which was just recallibrated. This thermometor was off by 100 degrees on both oven shelves! Since they claim to stand by their products, and I discarded the box, I wrote customer service. It took days to get a reply, and they said if I mail it back (it only cost $7!) they'll replace it. I would never buy a Polder product again.
customer_reviews.author: DiGi

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The one I recently purchased registered 100 Degrees cooler than actual temperature ... a friend tested it in her oven for me with the same result. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It sits on the rack without falling over. It clips over the rack in the perfect spot in the oven. Great design.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: NOT Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it clips on the rack, but it is ABSOLUTELY NOT ACCURATE!!!! I've set my oven to 350 three consecutive times. The readings from this thermometer were as follows 1) 275 2) 385 3) 320. I finally tested the temp with a laser thermometer which revealed that my oven is accurate to within +- 10 degrees. This thermometer is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: D. & K. Bessenbacher

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It reads about 80 degrees lower than the oven setting. We checked the oven temperature with a laser meter and found that at a 350 degree setting the laser meter indicated 348. So, we’ll still use this thermometer; but we’ll determine where it reads at different temperatures, (using the laser as a reference), and interpolate accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Jona 542
